intro: Muelleranthus stipularis, commonly known as the stipular muelleranthe, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. It grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have stipules at the base of each leaf stalk.
